com.kudler.markmywords.advice

Class ExceptionAdvice

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.kudler.markmywords.advice.ExceptionAdvice

  • @RestControllerAdvice
public class ExceptionAdvice
extends java.lang.Object
    Advice class to take over control of the application when an error is thrown in any other class. Instead of letting random methods catch the exceptions, we manage each one and have it return a custom JSON response to the user.

    • Method Detail

      • handleUploadException

        @ExceptionHandler(value=FileUploadException.class)
public org.springframework.http.ResponseEntity<CustomErrorResponse> handleUploadException(FileUploadException e)
        If a user incorrectly uploads a file(e.g. sends a file with the wrong extension), throw an exception and return a 400 response.
        Parameters:
        e - Instance of exception, usually includes a message that will be shown to the user so they understand the mistake.
        Returns:
        JSON Response with the exception name and an explanation of the problem.

      • handleBadParameterException

        @ExceptionHandler(value={BadParameterException.class,org.springframework.web.multipart.MultipartException.class})
public org.springframework.http.ResponseEntity<CustomErrorResponse> handleBadParameterException(java.lang.Exception e)
        If parameters in the POST body are not acceptable (e.g. "file" is missing, prefix is longer than the text, etc.)
        Parameters:
        e - Instance of exception, usually includes a message that will be shown to the user so they understand the mistake.
        Returns:
        JSON Response with the exception name and an explanation of the problem.

      • handleMaxSizeError

        @ExceptionHandler(value=org.springframework.web.multipart.MaxUploadSizeExceededException.class)
public org.springframework.http.ResponseEntity<CustomErrorResponse> handleMaxSizeError(org.springframework.web.multipart.MaxUploadSizeExceededException e)
        Spring throws MaxUploadSizeExceededException when file size is larger than spring.servlet.multipart.max-file-size. This method catches it and displays an warning in a user friendly response.
        Parameters:
        e - Instance of exception, usually includes a message that will be shown to the user so they understand the mistake.
        Returns:
        JSON Response with the exception name and an explanation of the problem.

      • handleParameterTypeMismatch

        @ExceptionHandler(value=org.springframework.web.method.annotation.MethodArgumentTypeMismatchException.class)
public org.springframework.http.ResponseEntity<CustomErrorResponse> handleParameterTypeMismatch(org.springframework.web.method.annotation.MethodArgumentTypeMismatchException e)
        Spring throws MethodArgumentTypeMismatchException when a POST parameter cannot be parsed into it's declared type. This method catches it and displays an warning in a user friendly response.
        Parameters:
        e - Instance of exception, usually includes a message that will be shown to the user so they understand the mistake.
        Returns:
        JSON Response with the exception name and an explanation of the problem.

      • exception

        @ExceptionHandler(value=java.lang.Exception.class)
public org.springframework.http.ResponseEntity<CustomErrorResponse> exception(java.lang.Exception e)
        Catch-all to handle unforeseen exceptions with grace.
        Parameters:
        e - Instance of exception, usually includes a message that will be shown to the user so they understand the mistake.
        Returns:
        JSON Response with the exception name and an explanation of the problem.

      • buildCustomErrorResponse

        public org.springframework.http.ResponseEntity<CustomErrorResponse> buildCustomErrorResponse(java.lang.String type,
                                                                                             java.lang.String message,
                                                                                             org.springframework.http.HttpStatus status)
        Helper method for taking information about a given exception and turning it into an easily readable JSON with customizable HTTP Status code.
        Parameters:
        type - Info on the exception typically the class name
        message - An easy to understand summary of what went wrong and how to fix it
        status - An HTTP Response Code to indicate something went wrong, typically something from teh 400s(client error)
        Returns:
        An HTTP Response containing all of the data to include in the JSON
